item.title: Rockstar Games Co-Founder's Upcoming Sci-Fi Game Reveals New Publisher
item.description:
Smilegate, the publisher behind games such as Lost Ark , has joined hands with Absurd Ventures to publish Rockstar Games co-founder Dan Houser's upcoming AAA game. Established in 2021, Absurd Ventures is a multimedia firm founded by Houser after leaving Rockstar Games in 2020.

Having spent around three decades in the gaming industry, Houser is a bona fide veteran who boasts an impressive portfolio, mainly thanks to his work at Rockstar Games. At his former organization, he contributed as one of the key creative minds behind mega-hits such as Red Dead Redemption 2 and Grand Theft Auto 5 . Back in May 2024, the first signs of Absurd Ventures working on an open-world action-adventure game emerged, signaling Houser's return to game development. During the same year, Smilegate's investment in the studio's projects was also announced.

Smilegate to Publish Upcoming Absurd Ventures Game

Now, over a year later, Smilegate revealed that it was publishing a AAA game set in Absurd Ventures' A Better Paradise universe. The project was described as an open-world, sci-fi, action-adventure title that was in "early development." Notably, Dan Houser is writing for the game while also serving as its creative director. The ex- GTA lead is collaborating with Lazlow Jones and Michael Unsworth, two important figures from his Rockstar Games days, on this project. Moreover, it was shared that the game's senior developers comprised of former employees of renowned studios, including Bungie, Treyarch, Insomniac Games, and more. Reflecting on the nature of the game, Houser said that it was "an opportunity to go somewhere entirely different" and could be an "entirely new adventure" for players. The forthcoming game is the third project announced in the A Better Paradise universe, alongside 2024's audio series titled A Better Paradise Volume One: An Aftermath and its novel adaptation coming out later in 2025.

Smilegate's partnership with Absurd Ventures appears to be an encouraging sign for the in-development game, given the South Korean publisher's experience with handling popular titles such as Crossfire and Lost Ark . Moreover, the involvement of Unsworth, together with whom Houser wrote the award-winning Red Dead Redemption 2 , could certainly be seen as a major boost. Keeping in mind that Absurd Ventures is concurrently working on a few different projects, including an action-comedy game teased in January, it may be some time before more updates about the aforementioned project are revealed.

Earlier this year, another game backed by an ex-Rockstar Games lead, called MindsEye , rolled out and instantly bombed. Having seen such a disastrous launch unfold, fans of Houser's work would hope that Absurd Ventures learns from MindsEye 's mistakes and avoids making the same. However, only time will tell if that will be enough to replicate some of the success experienced by Houser during his stint at his previous company.

item.title: Grounded 2: All Milk Molar Locations
item.description:
Milk Molars in Grounded 2 are rare collectibles that allow players to level up their health, stamina, and other stats. There are 32 Milk Molars to be found, and as players level up, stats will require two or more to increase. There are also 18 Mega Milk Molars in Grounded 2 , which can increase the stack size of certain resources.

This guide will show players where to find all the Milk Molar locations in Grounded 2 , broken down by Brookhollow Park's different regions.

Be sure to check out our full interactive map for Grounded 2 by clicking here.

All Milk Molars In The Snackbar Region

Milk Molar In The Snackbar Anthill

Players will enter the Snackbar Anthill as part of an early mission , and if they turn at the first right , they should see a Milk Molar.

Milk Molar Down A Small Cave, Guarded By A Red Soldier Ant

Down a small cave next to a white pipe under the Snackbar , players can enter a small cave . At the end, there is a Milk Molar guarded by a Red Soldier Ant , so it's best to arrive on an Ant Buggy to avoid combat.

Mega Milk Molar At The Back Of The Snackbar

At the back of the Snackbar , players can climb up a pair of pliers and then onto a ledge . The golden tooth is slightly covered by a leaf.

All Milk Molars In The Snackbar Front Region

You can click on the Milk Molars for hints on where to find them.

Milk Molar On The Wooden Platform

On the large wooden platform in front of the snackbar , there is a Milk Molar in the bottom left corner. To get up here, climb a white plastic knife .

Mega Milk Molar On The Headless BURG.L

On the upper right side of the Snackbar Front area , players will find a Mega Milk Molar atop the headless BURG.L . It is easier to climb the robot body with an Orb Weaver Buggy, but it can be done slowly on foot by walking up the spider webs .

Milk Molar Inside A Styrofoam Cup

One Milk Molar at the central lower section of the Snackbar Front area is found inside a white Styrofoam cup .

Mega Milk Molar Under The Camera

In the bottom right corner of the Snackbar Front area , there is a news camera . Underneath here, there is a Mega Milk Molar on a ledge.

Milk Molar Inside A Cave Covered By Roots

Underneath the wooden platform , there is a cave that can't be accessed unless players have an Ant Buggy to chomp down the roots . Players will be guided here during the 'Art of War' quest , where they will find a Milk Molar and an Optical Disk.

A Milk Molar & Mega Milk Molar In The Hatchery Anthill

Players should enter the Hatchery Anthill with their Ant Buggy via the Southern Entrance , which is just over the border into the Entrance region.

By chomping down different roots inside the Anthill, they will eventually find a Milk Molar and a Mega Milk Molar in different spots .

All Milk Molars In The Entrance Region

Mega Milk Molar At The North Of The Entrance In A Blocked Cave

At the northern border of the Entrance area, and to the left of the Hatchery Anthill: South Entrance , there is a small cave blocked by roots. Use an Ant Buggy to clear the roots and claim the Mega Milk Molar inside.

Milk Molar Out In The Open, South Of The Mega Milk Molar

Just to the south of the previous Mega Milk Molar , players should find a standard Milk Molar out in the open. On the map, it is where the golden leaves start.

Milk Molar, A Small Way Up The Tree

Players can climb the tree in the middle of the Entrance area by jumping from mushroom to mushroom on their mount . A short way up, there is a Milk Molar on one of these mushroom ledges .

Players will need to upgrade their Omni-Hammer to break Mega Milk Molars.

Milk Molar On The Left Side Of The Tree Area In A Blocked Cave

On the left side of the tree , but on the ground, players should find a root-covered cave . Inside, another passage is blocked and can only be broken with explosives .

Milk Molar Found Beneath The Garbage Can

Beneath the Garbage Can in the southeast section of the Entrance Area, players will find a Styrofoam cup with a Milk Molar inside . A gas mask is not required for this one.

Mega Milk Molar Atop The Garbage Can Under A Green Book

Players will need a gas mask , and then they can use this guide to climb the Garbage Can. Underneath a green and purple book , they should find a golden tooth.

All Milk Molars In The Ice Cream Cart Region

Players will want to wear chilling protection to find the Milk Molars near or inside the actual ice cream cart.

Milk Molar In A Cave On The East Side Of The Ice Cream

On the east side of the spilled ice cream , players will find a cave near the Milk Molar is marked on the map. The tooth is found easily in the cave.

Milk Molar In A Cave Underneath The Back Of The Cart

Head to the south of the cart and look underneath the cart for a cave . A Milk Molar is found inside.

Milk Molar In The Left Corner Of The Cart's Entrance

There are three Molars found inside the cart with players needing to climb up . The first can be found in the left corner as players walk in .

Mega Milk Molar Inside The Ice Cream Cart Engine Room

Inside the depths of the Ice Cream Cart, players should find a frozen engine . They can smash the icicles , briefly giving life to the machinery, at which point a yellow blade will move, uncovering a hole where Raw Science and a Mega Milk Molar can be found.

Mega Milk Molar Atop The Ice Cream Cart, On Its Wheel

Continuing from the previous location, players can now climb the yellow blades and then some leaves to the top of the cart (technically it's side as it's overturned).

There are many of Grounded 2's hostile creatures up here, so get ready for a fight . The Mega Milk Molar Is Found in the middle of the cart's wheel .

All Milk Molars In The Ceremony Region

Mega Milk Molar In The Terranium

In the lower right corner of the Ceremony area, there is a broken glass terranium . At the back right of the terranium , lies a Mega Milk Molar.

Mega Milk Molar On The Lectern Inside Styrofoam Cups

In the top left corner of the Ceremony area, there is a lectern . Players must use an Orb Weaver Buggy to climb to the second shelf of this, where there is a Mega Milk Molar inside a cup .

Two Milk Molars By The Huge Rock

At the center of the Ceremony area , there is a large rock . Two easy Milk Molars can be found on either side of it, one on the south side and the other on the eastern side , with this latter one being found underneath .

All Milk Molars In The Statue Region

Milk Molar In A Red Ball Inside A Maze

Just outside the Statue area, there is a white pipe next to a red tape . Head into the pipe and use an Ant Buggy to chomp down some roots. Eventually, this will lead to a stone maze .

At the gold ring, turn left and keep going until you reach the first right . Just ahead, there should be a red ball with a Milk Molar inside . The red ball can be seen on the map.

One of the best unlocks and upgrades in Grounded 2 is the Milk Molar Scanner , which will help players find all of these.

Mega Milk Molar Down A Hatch In A Facility

In the middle of the garden, to the left of the actual statue, there is a small yellow hatch on the map . Enter here and then use the Pneumatic Transit System to drop down to the level where a Mega Milk Molar can be found.

Milk Molar On The South Of The Statue's Small Garden

At ground level, head round to the south of the small garden . Here, there should be a hidden path into the hedge that encircles the statue. Walk a short way along a root to find a Milk Molar.

Milk Molar On The Far East Side Of The Statue

Continuing on from the last Molar , players should go straight until they come to the second opening on the right . This is an open area, and a stick can be climbed to a platform where a Milk Molar can be found.

Milk Molar In The Northeast Corner Of The Statue Area

This Milk Molar is easy to find in the northeast corner of the Statue area , where there are red flowers and red tape . It is on the floor next to a small body of water .

All Milk Molars In The Grass Games Region

Milk Molar By A Brick In The Southern Grass Games Region

In the bottom half of the Grass Games area , players can find this easy Milk Molar in a small ravine where there are lots of bricks .

Milk Molar In The Water Area Of The Grass Games Region

In the north of the Grass Games region, there is a body of water . Nestled between some rocks in the middle of this, and beneath a metal sprinkler with yellow bits , players will find another easy Milk Molar.

All Milk Molars In The Picnic Table Region

Mega Milk Molar In A Sealed Cave On The Left Of The Picnic Table Area

This Molar requires explosives to break a cave entrance in the far west side of the Picnic Table area.

Milk Molar In A Tunnel To The Southwest Of The Picnic Table

Just southwest of the actual Picnic Table , there is a tunnel , and if players head straight through it rather than going left or right, they will find a Milk Molar.

Milk Molar In The Toxic Anthill

There is one Milk Molar found in the Toxic Anthill , and it is easier to find from the North Entrance , which is under the bottom left part of the table .

Inside, head down and then left at the crossroads . Keep going down until you reach a more spacious area where the Milk Molar is found .

Milk Molar In The Northeast Corner Of The Picnic Area, Inside A Cup

One easy Milk Molar is found in the top right corner of the Picnic Table area . It is waiting inside a Styrofoam cup .

Mega Milk Molar Underneath The Tablecloth

On top of the Picnic Table, which can be climbed with an Orb Weaver Buggy , there is a part of the tablecloth that is raised up . Underneath here, players will find lots of spiders and a Mega Milk Molar.

Milk Molar In The Briefcase On The Picnic Table

There is a Milk Molar in the briefcase on top of the table . To open the briefcase, players will need to use the codes 137 and 514 for the left and right locks, respectively.

Milk Molar In The Cooler Next To The Briefcase On The Picnic Table

Next to the briefcase on top of the table, there is a cooler . Inside here, there is a bottle, and inside the bottle is a Milk Molar . If players are quick enough, they will not freeze even without the correct clothing.

All Milk Molars In The Fire Pit Region

Milk Molar Just Inside The Fire Pit In A Red Hand

Players will need to wear armor with Sizzle Protection to enter the actual fire pit , and just inside, they should see a large red hand with the Milk Molar inside it.

Mega Milk Molar On Top Of The Grill

After climbing the grill in the actual fire pit, for which Sizzle Protection is required, players can find the golden Mega Milk Molar next to a Billy Hog .

Milk Molar On The East Side Of The Fire Pit Region By Firewood

This Milk Molar is found on the right side of the Fire Pit region and is resting between some Firewood and a small spider's web.

Mega Milk Molar In A Cave North Of The Fire Pit

To find the Mega Milk Molar in the north of the Fire Pit region , players will need explosives . After entering the cave near where the Molar is marked on the map above, players should throw their explosives at the blocked entrance .

All Milk Molars In The Pine Hill Region

Milk Molar In The Southwest Of The Pine Hill Region

In the southwest corner of the Pine Hill region, just where the hedge begins , players will find an easy Milk Molar.

Two Milk Molars Just Northwest Of The Pine Hill Ranger Station

There are two more easy Milk Molars just northeast of the Pine Hill Ranger Station , and as a main quest for Grounded 2 takes place here, players should stumble upon them naturally.

Mega Milk Molar In The Northwest Of The Pine Hill Region

This golden Molar is easily accessible in the northwest corner of the Pine Hill region. It is inside a light green cage , with players climbing a brown feather to get inside.

Milk Molar In The Spider Den Anthill

Players will need their Ant Buggy to chomp down some roots after entering the south entrance of the Spider Den Anthill in the middle of the Pine Hill region.

After passing through the root wall, they should get to the Memorial Box , which leads to another cave where a Milk Molar can be found on the right-hand side ledge , as well as one of Grounded 2's Optical Disks.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Confirms Controversial Feature
item.description:
Battlefield 6 will use bots to fill match lobbies when there aren't enough human players, EA devs have confirmed. The upcoming shooter has promised many changes to right the wrongs of its disappointing previous release, but it's not changing everything, and some returning elements may not be what all fans want to hear. The return of bots to Battlefield 6 could be one such move.

So far, fans have seemed largely excited about the direction in which the franchise is going. Despite not even being out yet, Battlefield 6 is already topping sales charts on both Steam and PS5, and many early impressions refer to it as a return to the former glory of Battlefield 3 and 4. Still, there are some elements of the game that players may not want to see return.

Battlefield 6 Will Use Bots to Fill Multiplayer Matches

In a Q&A session reported by GNN, Battlefield 6 Development Director Anna Narrevik explained that when multiplayer servers aren't full, AI will fill the gap. That's nothing new for first-person shooters, or even the Battlefield series, as 2042 used bots this same way. However, it is a largely unpopular way to manage matchmaking, despite how prevalent it is across the genre. Numerous Call of Duty fans criticized Warzone Mobile 's use of bots after it introduced them, saying matches contained far too many AI players, leading to lopsided and unfulfilling victories for teams with more humans.

Gameplay Designer Jac Carlsson followed up by explaining that new players can use custom modes in the game's Portal mode to improve, making AI less of a necessity to lower the barrier for entry. That comment makes it sound like Battlefield 6 won't rely on bots too heavily, but it's difficult to say for sure without more specifics on how the system works. Narrevik said the main goal of the game's matchmaking is to allow as many players as possible to play at once, which may be less of a hurdle with Battlefield 6 's rumored return to 64-player matches than 2042 's 128-player rounds, but bots still pop up in smaller matches in other games.

If EA manages to hit its goal of 100 million Battlefield 6 players, there may be enough people on its servers, and bots may not be as frequent an appearance as they are in other titles. Still, their inclusion is not a popular move. How that will affect people's perception of the game going forward will only become clear once the game is out in full.

item.title: Original Guitar Hero Developer is Making a Comeback After 15 Years
item.description:
The studio responsible for the original Guitar Hero , RedOctane Games, has recently announced its comeback after 15 years. With over 25 million units sold, the Guitar Hero franchise was arguably one of the most popular rhythm series ever made, and many veteran gamers will likely be happy to see the return of the studio that started it.

Originally focused on creating game accessories for popular rhythm games, RedOctane Games was started by Kai and Charles Huang in 1999. The company gained prominence in 2005 with the release of the first Guitar Hero , which became a huge hit. Soon after the release of Guitar Hero 2 in 2006, RedOctane was acquired by Activision, where it collaborated with Neversoft on the franchise. In 2010, Activision shut down RedOctane.

Guitar Hero Developer HighOctane Returns After 15 Years

Now, RedOctane has been revived after 15 years, with Simon Ebejer as the studio’s head. Ebejer has previously worked on Guitar Hero while at Neversoft, and founders Kai and Charles Huang are said to be on the “special advisory board” of the company. It has been confirmed in a blog post, however, that RedOctane’s next game will not be Guitar Hero , but “something new,” which makes sense considering the studio does not own the IP.

Not much is officially known about the upcoming game, however, except that it will be a rhythm game likely inspired by Guitar Hero . Peripherals are not guaranteed, but considering RedOctane’s expertise with them, it would not be surprising to see the game employing them. The title also does not have an official release date, so gamers should wait for more information before getting too excited.

Despite Guitar Hero not having an official mainline game in a decade after the release of Guitar Hero Live in 2015, it’s fair to say that the series is still very popular. Earlier this year, for example, the franchise was in the spotlight after a Twitch streamer passed out while playing Through the Fire and Flames on Guitar Hero during a 200% speed challenge.

A few months ago, the Guitar Hero franchise also appeared in the middle of a controversy, as a Guitar Hero mobile ad made with AI enraged some gamers. However, it was soon revealed that the game teased by the ads did not exist, and it was only part of a market research campaign by Activision to test the franchise’s popularity. Hopefully, RedOctane will be able to deliver a proper game that will help long-time fans scratch the itch for a Guitar Hero -inspired title.

item.title: Battlefield 6's Beta Server Issues Are Already Sounding the Alarm
item.description:
Anticipation is really starting to build for the upcoming beta of Battlefield 6 , with the event having the potential to be a real watershed moment for the franchise. The title has received a lot of positive feedback through its wide-spanning and ambitious BF Labs playtesting system, creating even more of a positive buzz around its expanded open beta. The recent campaign and multiplayer gameplay reveals for the game were equally well-received, creating a perfect storm that DICE understandably wants to capitalize on.

The potential success and popularity of Battlefield 6 's open beta is already being evidenced, with tens of thousands of players already loading the game up despite the beta's early access not starting until August 7. There are already widespread reports of huge player queues as a result of this, creating some worry over how the beta's servers might handle the massive influx of players that Battlefield 6 will soon see. It is not unusual for massively anticipated titles to face disheartening server issues like this, and DICE needs to ensure that things run as smoothly as possible throughout the beta to really make the most of the opportunity.

Battlefield 6's Reported Server Issues Will Hopefully Not Be a Sign of Things to Come

The full open beta for Battlefield 6 is not set to launch until August 9, marking the first of two consecutive weekends of open beta access. Having said that, many players will have early access to the beta, starting on August 7 until August 8. This is directly tied to players who unlocked early access through Twitch drops, EA Play Pro subscriptions, or Battlefield Labs participation. Despite this early access period facilitating a smaller pool of players compared to the full open beta, a huge level of player engagement is already being seen.

Players will still be able to unlock early access to Battlefield 6 's beta, with Twitch drops once again being active between August 7-8.

As things stand, Battlefield 6 's beta has already amassed a Steam concurrent player count of around 25,000, with this just consisting of players who are likely getting their in-game settings ready for the upcoming experience. Additionally, players are now starting to report major server queues across most platforms, with queues as high as 50,000 being reported by some fans. This is an excellent indicator of how popular Battlefield 6 's beta is going to be, and these playership numbers are only likely to increase dramatically over the coming days.

The number of players engaging with Battlefield 6 during its open beta weekends is going to be significantly higher than the upcoming brief early access period, and it would be a real shame for this excitement to be drowned out by matchmaking issues like massive server queues. It seems likely that DICE will be monitoring these recent developments quite closely, with it potentially always being planned to bolster the server availability once the live beta period is active. Regardless, with early access starting so soon, it is understandable that some fans are worried.

DICE Cannot Let Battlefield 6's Potential Be Stifled By Server Issues

The relationship between DICE and the Battlefield community has been under a fair amount of strain in recent years. Entries like Battlefield 2042 indicated a real disconnect between the fanbase and the franchise's creative direction, though Battlefield 6 has marked a real positive turning point in this regard. DICE has already made good on its commitment to taking into account player-generated feedback with Battlefield 6 , and avoidable server congestion would only damage the positivity that has otherwise surrounded the IP in recent months.

Of course, Battlefield 6 is also in a prime position to compete directly against the upcoming Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 , potentially marking a huge turning point in the longstanding rivalry between both franchises. This places even more importance on the Battlefield 6 beta running smoothly and without serious issue, and a robust server infrastructure is arguably more important than anything else in this regard. It remains to be seen whether the recently reported server issues will extend into the Battlefield 6 open beta or early access, yet these reports will hopefully be a direct sign for DICE in terms of just how populated the game's servers might be over the coming days.
